Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. Number 5 -- 5.0 Mills - BOC
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District Number 5 Proposition

Summary:  Levy and collection of a 5.0 mills property tax within the Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 5, State of Louisiana, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2009, and annually thereafter, for the purpose of providing funds to be used by the Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 5 to acquire, improve and equip fire protection facilities, to acquire fire protection equipment and for any other lawful purpose of the Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 5, and to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith; and to authorize the funding of the proceeds of said tax into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall the Washington Parish Fire Protection District Number 5, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, La. R.S. 40:1501(A), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of 5.0 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $30,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire year), beginning with the tax collection for the year 2009, and annually thereafter, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used by the District to acquire, improve and equip fire protection facilities, to acquire fire protection equipment and for any other lawful purpose of the District, and to provide funds to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith; and shall the District be further authorized to fund proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?
